meanings.definition: The quality or state of being subject to chance or random occurrence.
meanings.sent1: The chancinesses of winning the lottery are very low.
meanings.sent2: She attributed the success of her business to the chancinesses of life.
meanings.sent3: The chancinesses of finding a four-leaf clover in a field of three-leaf ones made him laugh.
meanings.sent4: The chancinesses of fate brought them together in the most unexpected way.
meanings.sent5: The chancinesses of the weather made planning the outdoor event a risky endeavor.

meanings.definition: The likelihood of something happening by chance.
meanings.sent1: The chancinesses of encountering a celebrity in this small town are slim.
meanings.sent2: He relied on the chancinesses of meeting his old friend at the airport.
meanings.sent3: The chancinesses of winning a free trip to Hawaii seemed too good to be true.
meanings.sent4: The chancinesses of life sometimes lead to unexpected opportunities.
meanings.sent5: The chancinesses of the stock market can make or break an investor's portfolio.
